para.dtcname: Front Speed Sensor RH Output Malfunction
Abnormal Change in Output Signal of Front Speed Sensor RH (Test Mode DTC)
Abnormal Change in Output Signal of Front Speed Sensor LH (Test Mode DTC)
Front Speed Sensor LH Output Malfunction

content5.ptxt: Refer to DTCs C1401 and C1402.

data-name.name: detect-item
data-name.ptxt: Abnormal Change in Output Signal of Front Speed Sensor RH (Test Mode DTC)

item.ptxt: Front speed sensor RH
Front axle hub sub-assembly RH (Front speed sensor rotor RH)

data-name.name: detect-item
data-name.ptxt: Abnormal Change in Output Signal of Front Speed Sensor LH (Test Mode DTC)

item.ptxt: Front speed sensor LH
Front axle hub sub-assembly LH (Front speed sensor rotor LH)

data-name.name: detect-item
data-name.ptxt: Front Speed Sensor RH Output Malfunction

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: One of the following conditions is met:

item.ptxt: An open in the sensor signal circuit of a malfunctioning area occurs 255 times or more.
At a vehicle speed of 20 km/h (12 mph) or more, noise occurs in the sensor signals of a malfunctioning wheel 75 times or more within 5 seconds.
At a vehicle speed of 10 km/h (6 mph) or more, noise occurs once per rotor rotation for 15 seconds or more.
Front speed sensor RH
Skid control sensor wire RH
Speed sensor circuit
Front axle hub sub-assembly RH (Front speed sensor rotor RH)
Brake actuator assembly (Skid control ECU)

data-name.name: detect-item
data-name.ptxt: Front Speed Sensor LH Output Malfunction

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: One of the following conditions is met:

item.ptxt: An open in the sensor signal circuit of a malfunctioning area occurs 255 times or more.
At a vehicle speed of 20 km/h (12 mph) or more, noise occurs in the sensor signals of a malfunctioning wheel 75 times or more within 5 seconds.
At a vehicle speed of 10 km/h (6 mph) or more, noise occurs once per rotor rotation for 15 seconds or more.
Front speed sensor LH
Skid control sensor wire LH
Speed sensor circuit
Front axle hub sub-assembly LH (Front speed sensor rotor LH)
Brake actuator assembly (Skid control ECU)
DTCs C1413 and C1275 are for the front speed sensor RH.
DTCs C1414 and C1276 are for the front speed sensor LH.

content5.ptxt: Refer to DTCs C1405 and C1406.

item.ptxt: Check the speed sensor signal after cleaning or replacement.
Click here
Before disconnecting the connector, make sure that there are no problems with the connection.
After disconnecting the connector, make sure that the connector case and terminals are not deformed or corroded.

test1.ptxt: Using the GTS, check for any momentary interruption in the wire harness and connector corresponding to the DTC.

data-name.name: description
data-name.ptxt: Front speed sensor RH open detection

data-name.name: description
data-name.ptxt: Front speed sensor LH open detection

atten4.ptxt: Perform the above inspection before removing the sensor and connector.

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (FR/FL WHEEL SPEED)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Enter the following menus: Chassis / ABS/VSC/TRC / Data List.

data-name.name: remark
data-name.ptxt: No large fluctuations when driving at a constant speed.

data-name.name: remark
data-name.ptxt: No large fluctuations when driving at a constant speed.

test1.ptxt: Check that there is no difference between the speed value output from the speed sensor displayed on the GTS and the speed value displayed on the speedometer when driving the vehicle.

atten4.ptxt: Factors that affect the indicated vehicle speed include tire size, tire inflation and tire wear. The speed indicated on the speedometer has an allowable margin of error.
This can be tested using a speedometer tester (calibrated chassis dynamometer). For details about testing and the margin of error, refer to the reference chart.

specitem.ptxt: The speed value output from the speed sensor displayed on the GTS is the same as the actual vehicle speed measured using a speedometer tester (calibrated chassis dynamometer).

test1.ptxt: Perform the sensor check in the Test Mode Procedure.

specitem.ptxt: All test mode DTCs are cleared.

test1.ptxt: Drive the vehicle at a speed of 40 km/h (25 mph) or more for at least 60 seconds.
Check if the same DTC is output.

specitem.ptxt: There is no clearance between the sensor and the front steering knuckle.
The installation bolt is tightened properly.
No scratches, oil, or foreign matter on the sensor tip.

atten3.ptxt: If no damage to the speed sensor tip is found during this inspection, do not replace the speed sensor.

action.actiontitle: CLEAN OR REPLACE FRONT SPEED SENSOR

test1.ptxt: Remove the front axle hub and front disc.

specitem.ptxt: No scratches, oil, or foreign matter on the rotors.

atten4.ptxt: The front speed sensor rotor is incorporated into the front axle hub sub-assembly.
If the front speed sensor rotor needs to be replaced, replace it together with the front axle hub sub-assembly.

action.actiontitle: CLEAN OR REPLACE FRONT SPEED SENSOR ROTOR

test1.ptxt: Install the front axle hub and front disc.
Remove the skid control sensor wire.
Measure the resistance according to the value(s) in the table below.

entry.ptxt: B3 male connector 1 (FR-) or A-1 (FR-) - Body ground
B3 male connector 2 (FR+) or A-3 (FR+) - Body ground
I18 male connector 1 (FR-) or A-1 (FR-) - Body ground
I18 male connector 2 (FR+) or A-3 (FR+) - Body ground
A21 male connector 1 (FL-) or B-1 (FL-) - Body ground
A21 male connector 3 (FL+) or B-3 (FL+) - Body ground
Front view of wire harness connector
Front view of wire harness connector

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK HARNESS AND CONNECTOR (BRAKE ACTUATOR ASSEMBLY - FRONT SPEED SENSOR)

test1.ptxt: Install the skid control sensor wire.
Disconnect the A20 brake actuator assembly (skid control ECU) connector.
Disconnect the A and/or B speed sensor connector.
Measure the resistance according to the value(s) in the table below.

action.actiontitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE HARNESS OR CONNECTOR

test1.ptxt: Connect the brake actuator assembly (skid control ECU) connector.
Measure the voltage according to the value(s) in the table below.

entry.ptxt: Front view of wire harness connector

test1.ptxt: Drive the vehicle at a speed of 40 km/h (25 mph) or more for at least 60 seconds.
Check if the same DTC is output.
Drive the vehicle at a speed of 40 km/h (25 mph) or more for at least 60 seconds.
Check if the same DTC is output.
